boat.name: Norn
boat.full_description:
'Norn' is one of Paul Johnson's Venus 42 gaff-rigged ketches of which there are about ten worldwide. The design is based on that of a Colin Archer adapted for long distance cruising.

'Norn' was a liveaboard for 11 years until 2017, seven of these years were spent cruising abroad with a young daughter, covering over 30,000 nautical miles from London to Cape Verdes across to the Caribbean. 'Norn' has sailed as far south as Columbia and the Grenadines and as far north as Nova Scotia, Canada, before returning to the UK via the Azores.

Her previous owners sailed with their two children to New Zealand with a return trip around the Horn to the Falklands, and a trans-equatorial passage from there to the Azores.

'Norn' is a very heavy, safe boat that is fun to sail and is admired greatly whereever she goes. A massively strong gaff ketch designed for short handed long distance cruising, her sail plan along with her equipment is easily handled by a crew of two or even one.

The huge amount of glassfibre that has gone into the hull's construction makes her a strong but low maintenance vessel. The hull was re-epoxied in 2005.

The deck is two layers of marine ply over traditional laminated wooden deck beams. The deck was finished in 6mm glassfible with non-slip in 2006.
boat.construction_details: Heavy glassfibre and airex foam sandwich hull. Plywood deck over beams. Norwegian pine spars
boat.short_description: 'Norn' is a Venus 42 gaff rigged ketch designed by Paul Johnson and built in 1990. She has sailed extensively worldwide.

for_sales.sales_text:
This is a rare chance to own one of Paul Johnson"s Venus 42 gaff-rigged ketches of which there are about ten worldwide. The design is based on that of a Colin Archer adapted for long distance cruising.

"Norn" is a heavy displacment gaff rigged ketch designed by Paul Johnson. Her current owners have lived on board for 11 years. "Norn" took us safely on many long and short passages in conditions ranging from storms to flat calms with many perfect bits in between. We have moved off her now and she needs a new owner to take her sailing again.

Displacement : 18 tons
Length on Deck : 42 feet
Length Over spars :54 feet
Beam : 14 feet
Draft : 6 foot

Rig: Gaff rigged main and mizzen, 3 reefing points in main and two in mizzen. Main, mizzen, staysail and working jib all in heavy duradon (tan bark colour). Topsail : white dacron.

Jib : white dacron. Light weight genoa : dacron. Assymetric spinnaker with snuffer.

Engine : Kubuto 4 cylinder, 38hp, diesel engine, hurth 2.5 to 1 marine gearbox. Complete overhall in 2007 including heat exchanger, injectors, new gearbox, and all new stern gear.

Two separate 40 gallon s/s fuel tanks

Accommodation: open plan with 1 double and 2 singles in main saloon. One double in forward cabin.

Galley: 4 burner gas stove, fridge, double sink.

Saloon: Sigma diesel stove with oven and hot plate for alternative cooking and heating. Stove also heats two radiators fore and aft.

Water tanks: 4 x 50 gallon under berths and seating

Cockpit: small sea worthy, quick draining with tiller stearing. Aries windvane. Gimballed compass.

Equipment: Simpson Lawrence 555 manual anchor windlass with gypsy. Approx. 100 mts of 1/2' galvanised chain. 601b CQR anchor. Fortress 55 anchor. 30kgs Bruce anchor. Two lengths of 10 mts ½' spare anchor chain. 100 mts of 24mm multiplat nylon anchor rode. A further 60 mts of smaller gage anchor rode. Giving Norn the possibility of laying 3 anchors.

Aries self-steering gear. Garmin GPS, ICS Navtex/weatherfax, VHF radio telephone. Icom M700 SSB radio and antenna tuner (2006). 406 EPIRB. Raymarine ST60 and depth sounder (above and below) Raymarine ST4000 tiller pilot and ST60 multi repeater. Xantrax digital battery monitor. Three grid-type compasses. Avon 6-person Iiferaft. Inflatable dinghy. Orrow RC pack of flares. A selection of approximately 200 charts can be made available together with a large quantity of spares. Green canvas covers by Gowan for the staysail, mainsail and mizzen booms, liferaft and stove chimney. Also a bimini cover and fawn canvas hatch covers for the three deek hatches. Purpose box on deck for gas bottle stowage. a Mercury 3.2 outboard motor, Aerogen 4 wind generator and an Aqua air water generator.

Ground Tackle: four anchours: 65Ib CQR and  Fortress FX55 on main anchour cats. 30KG Bruce and spare 65Ib CQR stored down below. Aprox 100 meters of 12mm chain on main windlass.  three other anchour chains , one  20 meters and two 10 meters. all 12mm. two 50 meter anchour ropes one (unused) emergency 24mm multiplate for anchour or sea drogue.
